The lines above were cut-and pasted from sage after run after running
dancing links on the wordle word list.  They correspond to the letters
of the alphabet and the final column is the wildcard.

```{r}
f <- function(M,invert=FALSE){
  out <- ""
  for(i in seq_len(nrow(M))){
  wanted <- M[i,seq_len(26)]>0
  if(invert){wanted <- !wanted}
  out <- paste(out, paste(letters[wanted],collapse=""),sep=" ")
  }
  out
}

f(L[[1]])
f(L[[2]])
f(L[[3]])
f(L[[4]])
f(L[[5]])
f(L[[6]])
f(L[[7]])
f(L[[8]])
f(L[[9]])
f(L[[10]])
```

Then to get the actual words we use `egrep`.  Taking the penultimate
group's `eglnt` as an example, we would use:

```{bash}
cat wordle_words | egrep "e" | egrep "g" | egrep "l" | egrep "n" | egrep "t"
```

There should be an easier method in R:

```{r}
a <- readLines("wordle_words")

extractall <- function(wanted){
out <- NULL
for(o in a){
  x <- strsplit(o,"")[[1]]
  if(all(sort(x) == wanted)) {out <- c(out, paste(x,collapse=""))}
  }
  return(out)
}

extract2 <- function(M){
   out <- NULL
   for(i in seq_len(nrow(M))){
   wanted <- letters[M[i,seq_len(26)]>0]
   out <- paste(out, extractall(wanted), sep=" ")
   }
   return(out)
}

for(o in L){ print(extract2(o)) }	
```
